resources.string: SimpleLogin is a open source solution to protect your online identity.\n\nSimpleLogin strives to offer a simple experience for both users and partners/developers
Create quickly a random, secure email alias on any website.\n\nAll emails going to an alias will be forwarded to your personal inbox.
Simply bock an alias if it\'s too spammy.

Not only an alias can receive emails, it can send emails too.

Simply hit "Reply" in your favorite email client and the reply will come from the alias.

Your personal email address is never revealed.

Email alias is similar to forward email address: all emails sent to an alias will be forwarded to your inbox.

Thanks to SimpleLogin technology, an alias can also send emails.

For your contact, the alias is therefore your email address.
Yes! An email alias is actually a normal email address that exists forever unless you remove it on your SimpleLogin dashboard.

SimpleLogin alias are permanent as opposed to the temporary emails created on services like temp-mail.org, 10minutesmail.net, etc.

SimpleLogin also doesn't store the emails.

We are simply different products for different usecases.

SimpleLogin doesn\'t store the emails (we don\'t want to become another Gmail üí∞).\n\nTechnically the emails DO arrive at SimpleLogin server and we modify email headers to implement the \"magic\" but the email content is never read.

For security reason and to avoid database leak, all \"forgot password\" requests are taken into account silently without you being informed if a request is successful or not.\n\nSo make sure that you enter the correct email address.
üí°Hint: To make it easy to remember for later use, it is a good practice to use the name of the website/service that you plan to register with alias.
‚ö†Ô∏è Only letters, numbers, dash (-) & underscore (_) are allowed.
